c2: Those who plot the destruction of others often perish in the attempt. - Thomas Moore
In taking revenge
d3: a man is but even with his enemy; but in passing it over

c2: One good act of vengeance deserves another. - Jon Jefferson
You cannot get ahead while you are getting even. - Dick Armey
Don't get mad
d3: get even. - Robert F. Kennedy

c2: Revenge is profitable. - Edward Gibbon
An eye for an eye makes the whole world blind. - Gandhi
If an injury has to be done to a man it should be so severe that his vengeance need not be feared. - Machiavelli
Live well. It is the greatest revenge. - The Talmud
Revenge
d3: at first though sweet
column5: Bitter ere long back on itself recoils. - John Milton

c2: Before you embark upon a journey of revenge
d3: you should first dig two graves. - Confucius

c2: ...dissent
d3: rebellion
column5: and all-around hell-raising remain the true duty of patriots. - Barbara Ehrenreich

c2: A citizen of America will cross the ocean to fight for democracy
d3: but won't cross the street to vote... - Bill Vaughan

c2: I was born an American; I will live an American; I shall die an American! - Daniel Webster
We must not confuse dissent with disloyalty. - Edward R. Murrow
Patriotism is your conviction that this country is superior to all others because you were born in it. - George Bernard Shaw
Patriotism is a arbitrary veneration of real estate above principles. - George Jean Nathan
A man's feet must be planted in his country
d3: but his eyes should survey the world. - George Santayana

c2: Patriotism ruins history. - Goethe
Ask not what your country can do for you
d3: but what you can do for your country. - John F. Kennedy

c2: The nation is divided
d3: half patriots and half traitors
column5: and no man can tell which from which. - Mark Twain

c2: If you want a symbolic gesture
d3: don't burn the flag; wash it. - Norman Thomas

c2: I will fight for my country
d3: but I will not lie for her. - Zora Neale Hurston

c2: Patriotism is supporting your country all the time
d3: and your government when it deserves it. - Mark Twain

c2: A nation reveals itself not only by the men it produces but also by the men it honors
d3: the men it remembers. - John F. Kennedy

c2: I only regret that I have but one life to give for my country. - Nathan Hale
Patriotism varies
d3: from a noble devotion to a moral lunacy. - W.R. Inge

c2: If you are ashamed to stand by your colors
d3: you had better seek another flag. - Anonymous

c2: Nationalism is an infantile disease.  It is the measles of mankind. - Albert Einstein
If our country is worth dying for in time of war let us resolve that it is truly worth living for in time of peace. - Hamilton Fish
It is lamentable
d3: that to be a good patriot one must become the enemy of the rest of mankind. - Voltaire

c2: Traditional nationalism cannot survive the fissioning of the atom. One world or none. - Stuart Chase
We know where they are. They're in the area around Tikrit and Baghdad and east
d3: west
column5: south and north somewhat. - Donald Rumsfeld

c2: I would not say that the future is necessarily less predictable than the past. I think the past was not predictable when it started. - Donald Rumsfeld
It is easy to take liberty for granted
d3: when you have never had it taken from you. - Dick Cheney

c2: Principle is OK up to a certain point
d3: but principle doesn't do any good if you lose. - Dick Cheney

c2: I love America more than any other country in this world; and
d3: exactly for this reason
column5: I insist on the right to criticize her perpetually. - James Baldwin

c2: As we express our gratitude
d3: we must never forget that the highest appreciation is not to utter words
column5: but to live by them. - John F. Kennedy
